ISSUE.TITLE: podman-run.1: --userns=auto: use smaller number as subuid size in the example
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-run.1.html#userns-mode says under `--userns=auto`: ``` Example: `containers:2147483647:2147483648`. ``` The line is block-quoted. I think the word `Example` should be on the previous line, thus the word should not be block-quoted, and the documentation should not contain backticks. Irrespective of this I think this example is valid, but misleading. The syntax of the line is - https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/subuid.5.html : name:start number: size(count). So the above size is 2147483648. I think this example can easily be misinterpreted that the last number means the end of the range, so the size will be one. I suggest to use as size some number, smaller than the range start, e.g. 65536.
